content: hey craft was great to have you with me now the inspiration for this craft came
from the fam Dover module the new 5b module and that's what I used it for but
you can use it for almost anything really you could use it for gate like a
doorway gate so but I used it for the fan delver module and the crag mah
hideout where the water comes rushing down from the top of the cave it holds
the water in so that's what I was going for with this but like I said it can be
used for any kind of gate so let's go to the table and I'll show you how I
started that hey guys so I've cut my craft sticks 2 inches long for this
craft and I'm gonna use white glue because this is gonna be a door and I
don't want the hot glue just squeezed between the pieces and make it hard for
the door to come up so this will make it the door very smooth and easy for it to
come out of the gate so that's why I'm gonna use the white glue here now I'm
gonna reinforce that with some pieces that are cut from these tongs those
wooden tongs so I've got the white part on the top and the small part on the
bottom I'm just gonna glue those on with the white glue and I'll let that dry up
so now I want to make the the gate itself so I've got these pieces they're
roughly 2 inches long it's goblin construction suicide that important but
I've marked them in half so I'm going to glue along the 1/2 side and add another
stick to it and that'll make the channel for the gate and I'll do it on the other
piece and let that harden up a second and then I'll put the other piece on so
I'll get a nice channel for my gate to slide in ok and there you go
the other piece done so now we have 2 so now we can slide the door up and down in
those channels alright so here's my pieces and I got the door and it fits
nicely in that channel and I can remove it so there we go I'm gonna glue this to
another scrap stick so that it will stand up ok I'm going to put some other
roughly 2 inch long walls next to it and I'm
I'm using the hot glue because it's not important that it's that it's smooth or
anything so this is actually gonna be a goblin construction so get the last
piece on here and have that complete whole set and it's in gate I'll show you
here okay so I've got my my wall there and the gate okay so now I'm going to
add some detail to the door itself and I'm gonna pull down because this is
actually gonna be from a reservoir and water spills over it and I thought
that'd be a neat effect to add a little bit of hot glue on there that I can
paint like a mossy green okay add a little bit to the top so it's kind of a
water spills over it and everything so I thought that was kind of neat okay now I
want a base now this is an inch wide base it's just cardstock but I want it
so that this thing doesn't fall over so easily because it's only on one craft
stick so I'm going to glue that to the cardstock base and that would give me a
nice I stand there but I'm also gonna add some detail to the base so it
doesn't just look like a flat card it's gonna look more like a cavern floor okay
so I'll just fill that in with it some hot glue and see the detail there
texture so I'll do the other side also and I'll be finished with that so here's
my door and I want to add some braces to this because I'm going to add a rope
pulley that pulls this door up so I'm gonna add a brace to each of these
pieces here the each of the reinforcement pieces so I've got another
one that I've already bent all ready to go so knees my hot glue and just pop it
on there so that give a nice bond and pull down so it's flat you get a nice
brace there and we paint that up it'll look great and it did of course is
cardstock right now but once it's painted it'll look cool okay so we'll
let that harden up a sec and be ready for the next step okay now I've got some
small beads and I want the ropes to attach to the braces and that's
to do it with the beads so I'm gonna use my goop to attach the beads to these
cardstock braces just put some goop on there and pop the beads on there and
then just let it dry up and here's my wall where the door goes into but I want
to add some some more detail I'm at some reinforcers so I'm going to cut these
matchstick size craft sticks in half and I'm just gonna hot glue them to the
front and just be some reinforcement and some more detail to this wall here this
gate and I'm also going to add a little bit of hot glue to it to give it a
little bit of because like I said there's water behind this so give a
little bit of mossy look or an old look there we go all set now I got my door in
my gate and I'm going to add some glue to this to both because I want to
reinforce this and this will kind of help this is a way you can reinforce the
wooden pieces it'll just get in all the cracks and just make it give a little
more strength you don't have to do this but I like to do this especially with
hot glue pieces because they can just snap off but if the glue gets in the
cracks it'll it'll seal it hey guys I hope you enjoyed the gate vid
make sure to check out the second part when it's released so that you can see
how to finish up the gate and give your Scottie a like if you did like the video
also make sure to subscribe if you're not subscribed to the channel there's
tons of great content join my facebook or forum fantastic people on there that
are always sharing ideas and last but not least go forth and crafts
hey look a gate I wonder what happens if I lift the gate there we go no Roderick
